text: Food was average and creme brulee was awful - the sugar was charred , not caramelized and smelled of kerosene .
Yes , they use fancy ingredients , but even fancy ingredients do n't make for good pizza unless someone knows how to get the crust right .
But , nothing stands out about the cooking .
The highlight of the night was the mayonaisse for my side of fries I received from one of the food runners , which is not good considering the bill was nearly $ 100 .
I only tried a simple dish of spinach ravioli in a light oil and garlic sauce , but it actually faired better than most NYC Italian joints I 've tried similar dishes at .
label_text: [('spinach ravioli in a light oil and garlic sauce', 'better', 'positive')]

text: We 've been following chef Lyle 's food around New York for 15 years and while remaining classic , his innovations with bistro fare have made us return and return .
The food was very well prepared .
The selection changes frequently but the basic dishes are always available .
Food was OK - fish was cooked well .
The owners and employees are friendly and their pizza is fantastic .
They smell like they stuff them with old canned vegetables like the spinach mushroom calzone .
The service is not consistently excellent -- just decent .
Their calzones are horrific , bad , vomit-inducing , YUCK .
But , they were too big for the bun .
at taj , vegetarians can rejoice-all the dishes are manna from heaven .
fine dining restaurant quality .
While the ambiance and atmosphere were great , the food and service could have been a lot better .

text: The only positive was the wait staff , which was prompt , knowledgable , and likeable .
Yet paired with such rude service , would never recommend for anyone interested in carrying any kind of conversation while there .
They were such a rip-off ( $ 8.95 for four small meat patties in steamed buns ) and not worth trying .

text: If it 's just a quick martini at the bar ( which I recommend Jeffery 's ) or a mind blowing Roast Chicken , go to Village !
I had a late dinner at Lucky Stike , a great name for a joint if ever I saw one .
But the pizza is way to expensive .
The dosas are skimpy , unattractive and drip with grease , and personally I 'd drink popcorn topping before I 'd eat another one of these .
The fried rice is amazing here .
They had scrapped the bottom of the vessel in which they make the rice -RESULT - WE HAD LARGE CHUNKS OF BURNT RICE IN OUR SERVING BOWL .
The food is alright - some stuff is good - some is not ( like the steak dish which tends to be dry ) .
From beginning appetizers , the scallops were incredible , to the delicious chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet , we were delighted by the taste sensations .
label_text: [('beginning appetizers', 'incredible', 'positive'), ('scallops', 'incredible', 'positive'), ('chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet', 'delicious', 'positive'), ('taste', 'delighted', 'positive')]

text: We had a party in their private room and they made it truly memorable and were very helpful in the planning .
The location and ambience is Ok but the food is what makes up for it .
